notes: Started attending a dance studio for K-pop and other styles, and began learning actively. I made many friends with similar interests. I was just a schoolgirl who loved to dance
Started a part-time job while balancing school, dance, and work.
Still working, but now in my final school year ? stressed by exams and decisions about college and my future.

Decided to study in Korea and began preparing documents while studying for Kazakhstan¡¯s Unified National Test (ENT) and national graduation exams. Worked to save money for the move, had fewer friends around, and felt a lot of stress. Moved to Korea at the end of the year.

A year of adaptation. Arriving in Korea felt both lonely and inspiring. I threw myself into language studies, spending up to 10 hours a day at the academy. Everything around me was new, and I explored as much as I could with the money I had.

Completed all six levels of the language program and earned TOPIK level 5. Faced new stress from working in Korea and preparing university applications. Was accepted into SeoulTech to study Computer Engineering.
Second year of my bachelor¡¯s. The courses are still challenging, but I¡¯m doing better than in 2024. I changed jobs and started earning more, but my sleep has become worse.
